WorkItem.ClosedComment:
Compile on save does not work currently for 0.9.0, you're seeing the compile on save behavior from web-essentials.

For the non-preview release of 0.9.0 we expect Compile on Save to work the same as 0.8.3.
WorkItem.Description:
i use hot page reloading (Chrome+"LivePage" Extension), hot unit testing (Karma test runner with "autowatch" turned on),  and the TS-to-JS hot preview (VS web-essentials preview window).

In each of these 3 situations, the user experience is greatly diminished due to the following once I press "Save (Ctrl-S)" for the typescript file I am editing in Visual Studio
1. Compile-to-JS takes aprox 5 seconds
2. About 10 seconds later, all .ts source-files in my project get recompiled (all .js files are resaved)

This causes the "hot" features to be delayed a considerable time, and also get double-reloaded due to the secondary full-project recompile.

I have gone through my visual studio project settings (including web-essential settings) and it seems the #2 issue of full-project recompile can not currently be disabled.    

Regression:  0.8.3.1 is much faster than 0.9.0 and doesn't always recompile everything (though it would be nice to be EVEN FASTER than 0.8.3.1)
WorkItem.Summary: 0.9.0 alpha VS plugin: recompile-on-save is slow, + always recompiles all files
